means: 搅动( agitate的过去式和过去分词 )
（尤指为法律、社会状况的改变而）激烈争论

word_mean: 激越的：明显不安及活动增加伴焦虑、畏惧和紧张

sentence.Network_en: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.
sentence.Network_cn: 她突然变得激动狂躁，四处乱跳还大喊大叫。

sentence.Network_en: Calm down! Don't get so agitated.
Anti - thrall leaders agitated the question of thrall for many years.
sentence.Network_cn: 反对奴隶制的领袖们就奴隶制问题进行了多年的激烈争论.

entry.def: If someone is agitated, they are very worried or upset, and show this in their behaviour, movements, or voice.

example.tran: 苏珊似乎因为什么事而烦躁不安。

example.ex: The man in the house was in a very excited and agitated state.
example.tran: 房子里的那名男子情绪非常激动且焦灼不安。

means.word_mean: 2. physically disturbed or set in motion;

auth_sentence.content: She was miserable and agitated and quarrelling with everyone.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was miserable and agitated and quarrelling with everyone.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was miserable and agitated and quarrelling with everyone.

auth_sentence.content: The pellucid water, though agitated...did not turn cloudy.
auth_sentence.res_content: The pellucid water, though agitated...did not turn cloudy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The pellucid water, though agitated...did not turn cloudy.

auth_sentence.content: Students were often tense and agitated during the experiment.
auth_sentence.res_content: Students were often tense and agitated during the experiment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Students were often tense and agitated during the experiment.

sentences.en: be in an agitated emotional state
sentences.cn: 处于一种情绪激动不安的情形

sentences.en: Because he’s very easily agitated at work.
sentences.cn: 因为他在工作时常常发火。

sentences.en: He was agitated about his wife’s health.
sentences.cn: 他为他妻子的健康焦虑不安。

sentences.en: His answers were all mixed up, so agitated was he.
sentences.cn: 他是那样心神不定，回答全乱了。
